Detailed Description

A container which holds relationship connections between two BoxLevels.

Connectors have a notion of a "base" and a "head", representing a directional relationship between two BoxLevels. The relationships are a collection of Boxes in the head, pointed to by a Box in the base. The association between base and head relationships is 1 .. 0-many. That is, one Box in the base can be related to zero or more Boxes (called its NeighborSet) in the head.

Usage
Connections in a Connector can have three possible relationships:

# A Box in the base has no related NeighborSet. In this case, the Box in the base will exist as-is in the head. # A Box in the base has NeighborSet which is empty. In this case, the Box from the base will not exist in the head BoxLevel. # A Box in the base has a corresponding NeighborSet which in non-empty. In this case, the NeighborSet contains the set of Boxes to which the Box in the base is related.

void SAMRAI::hier::Connector::finalizeContext (  ) 

Enforces implicit class invariants and removes non-local neighbors from relationships.

To be called after modifying a Connector's context through setBase, setHead, or setWidth methods.

Precondition:
d_base_handle && d_head_handle
getBase().getGridGeometry() == getHead().getGridGeometry()
(getBase().getRefinementRatio() >= getHead().getRefinementRatio()) || (getBase().getRefinementRatio() <= getHead().getRefinementRatio())
(getParallelState() == BoxLevel::DISTRIBUTED) || (getBase().getParallelState() == BoxLevel::GLOBALIZED)

Connector * SAMRAI::hier::Connector::createLocalTranspose (  )  const [virtual]

Create and return this Connector's transpose, assuming that all relationships are local (no remote neighbors).

If any remote neighbor is found an unrecoverable assertion is thrown.

Non-periodic relationships in are simply reversed to get the transpose relationship. For each periodic relationship we create a periodic relationship incident from the unshifted head neighbor to the shifted base neighbor. This is because all relationships must be incident from a real (unshifted) Box.

Reimplemented in SAMRAI::hier::MappingConnector.

References convertHeadWidthToBase(), doLocalTransposeWork(), getBase(), getConnectorWidth(), and getHead().

Referenced by SAMRAI::hier::MappingConnectorAlgorithm::modify().

Connector * SAMRAI::hier::Connector::createTranspose (  )  const [virtual]

Create and return this Connector's transpose.

Similar to createLocalTranspose(), but this method allows non-local edges. Global data is required, so this method is not scalable.

Reimplemented in SAMRAI::hier::MappingConnector.

References convertHeadWidthToBase(), doTransposeWork(), getBase(), getConnectorWidth(), and getHead().

Connector & SAMRAI::hier::Connector::operator= ( const Connector &  rhs  ) 

Assignment operator.

Reimplemented in SAMRAI::hier::MappingConnector.

bool SAMRAI::hier::Connector::operator== ( const Connector &  rhs  )  const

Equality operator checks relationship data, Connector width and equality of base and head Box pointers.

CAUTION
Equality here means just the local parts are equal. This means that one processor may see the equality differently from another.

The cost for the comparison is on the order of the local relationship count. However, an object may be compared to itself, an efficient operation that always returns true. When comparing Connector objects, if you expect equality to hold, using the same objects would improve performance.

References isFinalized().

bool SAMRAI::hier::Connector::operator!= ( const Connector &  rhs  )  const

Inequality operator checks the same data that equality operator checks.

See also:
operator==( const Connector &rhs );

References isFinalized().

void SAMRAI::hier::Connector::setParallelState ( const BoxLevel::ParallelState  parallel_state  ) 

Set the parallel distribution state.

Before a Connector can be in a GLOBALIZED state, the base BoxLevel given in setBase() must already be in GLOBALIZED mode. The base BoxLevel should remain in GLOBALIZED mode for compatibility with the Connector.

This method is not necessarily trivial. More memory is required to store additional relationships.

For serial (one processor) runs, there is no difference between the parallel states (except for the names), and there is no real cost for switching parallel states.

Parameters:
[in] parallel_state 
Precondition:
isFinalized()

References SAMRAI::hier::BoxNeighborhoodCollection::clear(), SAMRAI::hier::BoxLevel::DISTRIBUTED, SAMRAI::hier::BoxLevel::GLOBALIZED, isFinalized(), and TBOX_ERROR.

Referenced by SAMRAI::hier::operator<<().

bool SAMRAI::hier::Connector::isTransposeOf ( const Connector &  other  )  const

Return true if two Connector objects are transposes of each other.

Each Connector represents a set of directed relationships incident from its base to its head. The transpose represent the relationships in the opposite direction. In order for two Connector objects to be transpose of each other, their Connector widths and base refinement ratios must be such that an relationship in one set also appears in the other set. A transpose set must have

  • base and head BoxLevels reversed from the untransposed set.
  • the same Connector width, although it is described in the index space of a different base BoxLevel.
Parameters:
[in] other 

References convertHeadWidthToBase(), getBase(), getHead(), and SAMRAI::hier::BoxLevel::getRefinementRatio().

Referenced by SAMRAI::hier::BoxLevelConnectorUtils::addPeriodicImagesAndRelationships(), doLocalTransposeWork(), doTransposeWork(), SAMRAI::mesh::TreeLoadBalancer::loadBalanceBoxLevel(), SAMRAI::mesh::CascadePartitioner::loadBalanceBoxLevel(), and SAMRAI::hier::MappingConnectorAlgorithm::modify().

IntVector SAMRAI::hier::Connector::convertHeadWidthToBase ( const IntVector &  base_refinement_ratio,
const IntVector &  head_refinement_ratio,
const IntVector &  head_gcw 
) [static]

Given the Connector width in the head index space, convert it to the base index space.

This method is useful for computing Connector widths for transpose Connectors. It handles negative refinement ratios. By SAMRAI convention, a refinement ratio of -N is interpreted as 1/N.)

This method is static because (1) it has nothing to do with an existing Connector object, and (2) it is often used to compute a Connector's initializing data.

Parameters:
[in] base_refinement_ratio 
[in] head_refinement_ratio 
[in] head_gcw The connector width in the head index space.
Returns:
A copy of the connector width converted to the base index space.
Precondition:
(base_refinement_ratio >= head_refinement_ratio) || (base_refinement_ratio <= head_refinement_ratio)

References SAMRAI::hier::IntVector::ceilingDivide(), SAMRAI::hier::IntVector::getDim(), SAMRAI::hier::IntVector::getOne(), SAMRAI::hier::IntVector::getZero(), TBOX_ASSERT, and TBOX_ERROR.

Referenced by SAMRAI::hier::MappingConnector::createLocalTranspose(), createLocalTranspose(), SAMRAI::hier::MappingConnector::createTranspose(), createTranspose(), isTransposeOf(), recursivePrint(), and SAMRAI::xfer::RefineSchedule::RefineSchedule().

size_t SAMRAI::hier::Connector::checkConsistencyWithBase (  )  const

Check for consistency between the relationship data and base boxes, and return the number of consistency errors.

Consistency stipulates that each neighbor list must correspond to a base box.

relationship consistency errors should be treated as fatal because many operations assume consistency.

void SAMRAI::hier::Connector::setTranspose ( Connector *  transpose,
bool  owns_transpose 
) [inline]

Sets this Connector's transpose and, if the transpose exists, sets its transpose to this Connector. If owns_transpose is true then this object will delete the transpose during its deletion.

Note:
If owns_transpose is false, then client code is responsible for the deletion of the transpose. Similarly, if owns_transpose is true client code must never explicitly delete the transpose.
Parameters:
[in] transpose 
[in] owns_transpose

size_t SAMRAI::hier::Connector::checkTransposeCorrectness ( const Connector &  transpose,
bool  ignore_periodic_relationships = false 
) const

Check that the relationships are a correct transpose of another Connector and return the number of erroneous relationships.

For every relationship in this Connector, there should be a corresponding relationship in the transpose Connector. Any missing or extra relationship constitutes an error.

Errors found are written to perr.

Parameters:
[in] transpose 
[in] ignore_periodic_relationships 
Returns:
Global number of errors in assuming that transpose is a transpose of *this.

int SAMRAI::hier::Connector::checkOverlapCorrectness ( bool  ignore_self_overlap = false,
bool  assert_completeness = true,
bool  ignore_periodic_images = false 
) const

Check that overlap data is correct (represents overlaps).

Checking is done as follows:

  • Find overlap errors using findOverlapErrors().
  • Report overlap errors to tbox::perr.
  • Return number of local errors.
Note:
This is an expensive operation (it uses findOverlapErrors()) and should only be used for debugging.
See also:
findOverlaps()
Parameters:
[in] ignore_self_overlap Ignore a box's overlap with itself
[in] assert_completeness If false, ignore missing overlaps. This will still look for overlaps that should not be there.
[in] ignore_periodic_images If true, do not require neighbors that are periodic images.
Returns:
Number of overlap errors found locally.
Precondition:
(getBase().isInitialized()) && (getHead().isInitialized())
!hasPeriodicLocalNeighborhoodBaseBoxes()

References begin(), SAMRAI::hier::Box::coarsen(), end(), findLocal(), findOverlapErrors(), getBase(), SAMRAI::hier::Box::getBlockId(), SAMRAI::hier::BoxLevel::getBoxStrict(), getConnectorWidth(), SAMRAI::hier::BoxLevel::getGridGeometry(), getHead(), getHeadCoarserFlag(), getRatio(), SAMRAI::hier::Box::grow(), hasPeriodicLocalNeighborhoodBaseBoxes(), SAMRAI::hier::Box::numberCells(), numLocalNeighbors(), SAMRAI::tbox::perr, SAMRAI::hier::Box::refine(), TBOX_ASSERT, and TBOX_ERROR.

void SAMRAI::hier::Connector::findOverlapErrors ( boost::shared_ptr< Connector > &  missing,
boost::shared_ptr< Connector > &  extra,
bool  ignore_self_overlap = false 
) const

Find errors in overlap data of an overlap Connector.

An error is either a missing overlap or an extra overlap.

This is an expensive operation and should only be used for debugging.

Assertions
This version throws an assertion only if it finds inconsistent Connector data. Missing and extra overlaps are returned but do not cause an assertion.
Parameters:
[out] missing 
[out] extra 
[in] ignore_self_overlap 
Precondition:
(getBase().isInitialized()) && (getHead().isInitialized())

int SAMRAI::hier::Connector::getGlobalNumberOfNeighborSets (  )  const [inline]

Return global number of neighbor sets.

This requires a global sum reduction, if the global size has not been computed and cached. When communication is required, all processors must call this method. To ensure that no communication is needed, call cacheGlobalReducedData() first.

Precondition:
isFinalized()

References cacheGlobalReducedData(), isFinalized(), and TBOX_ASSERT.

int SAMRAI::hier::Connector::getGlobalNumberOfRelationships (  )  const [inline]

Return global number of relationships.

This requires a global sum reduction if the global size has not been computed and cached. When communication is required, all processors must call this method. To ensure that no communication is needed, call cacheGlobalReducedData() first.

Precondition:
isFinalized()

References cacheGlobalReducedData(), isFinalized(), and TBOX_ASSERT.

void SAMRAI::hier::Connector::cacheGlobalReducedData (  )  const

If global reduced data (global number of relationships, etc.) has not been updated, compute and cache them (communication required).

After this method is called, data requiring global reduction can be accessed without further communications, until the object changes.

Sets d_global_data_up_to_date;

Precondition:
isFinalized()
